extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5143, TRANSPARENT INSURANCE STANDARDS ACT OF 2016; PROVIDING FOR PROCEEDINGS DURING THE PERIOD FROM DECEMBER 9, 2016, THROUGH JANUARY 3, 2017; AND PROVIDING FOR...; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 176

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5143, to provide greater transparency and congressional oversight of international insurance standards setting processes, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 170 nays, Roll No. 613.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-68 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.<P/>DeSantis amendment (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 114-846) that adds an additional requirement that the international agreement must be written in plain writing, as defined by the Plain Writing Act of 2010.<P/>H. Res. 944, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5143) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to 180 noes, Roll No. 610, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 178 nays, Roll No. 609.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5143, to provide greater transparency and congressional oversight of international insurance standards setting processes, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 170 nays, Roll No. 613.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-68 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.<P/>DeSantis amendment (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 114-846) that adds an additional requirement that the international agreement must be written in plain writing, as defined by the Plain Writing Act of 2010.<P/>H. Res. 944, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5143) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to 180 noes, Roll No. 610, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 178 nays, Roll No. 609.

titleInfo.title: ARBUCKLE PROJECT MAINTENANCE COMPLEX AND DISTRICT OFFICE CONVEYANCE ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: ARBUCKLE PROJECT MAINTENANCE COMPLEX AND DISTRICT OFFICE CONVEYANCE ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 176

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Arbuckle Project Maintenance Complex and District Office Conveyance Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, December 6th:<P/>H.R. 1219, amended, to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain land and appurtenances of the Arbuckle Project, Oklahoma, to the Arbuckle Master Conservancy District, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 412 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 611; and

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Daniel J. Evans Olympic National Park Wilderness Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, December 6th:<P/>S. 3028, to redesignate the Olympic Wilderness as the Daniel J. Evans Wilderness, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 401 yeas to 8 nays with 2 answering ``present'', Roll No. 612.

extension.searchTitle: TRANSPARENT INSURANCE STANDARDS ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 176

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5143, to provide greater transparency and congressional oversight of international insurance standards setting processes, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 170 nays, Roll No. 613.

The House passed H.R. 5143, to provide greater transparency and congressional oversight of international insurance standards setting processes, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 170 nays, Roll No. 613.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-68 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: To Research, Evaluate, Assess, and Treat Astronauts Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 6076, amended, to require the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to establish a program for the medical monitoring, diagnosis, and treatment of astronauts, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 413 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 614;

extension.searchTitle: CLOTURE MOTION; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 176

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate resumed consideration of the conference report to accompany S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military D1107construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 92 yeas to 7 nays (Vote No. 158), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the conference report to accompany the bill.
